metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20330 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
The tjLoadImage function in libjpeg-turbo 2.0.1 has an integer overflow with a resultant heap-based buffer overflow via a BMP image because multiplication of pitch and height is mishandled, as demonstrated by tjbench.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjpeg-turbo-progs - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.1
libjpeg-turbo-test - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.1
libjpeg-turbo8 - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.1
libturbojpeg - 1.4.2-0ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libjpeg-turbo package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.2-0ubuntu3.1').
